REASONING: MMS-1B provides a grammatically coherent and contextually plausible hypothesis that matches common Hindi phrasing. The phrase "तुम्हारे पास तीन महीने बच्चे हैं" (You have a three-month-old child) is a natural and meaningful statement in Hindi. While "तुम गलत मंजिल पर हो" (You are on the wrong path) is a possible interpretation, it lacks contextual grounding and is less likely given the absence of any reference to "path" or "wrong direction" in the audio. MMS-ZeroShot-Constrained and Whisper provide no output, so MMS-1B is the most reliable and contextually accurate. The correction "हैं" (plural form) instead of "हैन" is linguistically accurate in Hindi.
